result.execSummary:
The defendant Andre R Beaton was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Pay DNA and all mandatory court costs, fees, surcharges and assessments.  To be paid by 2/11/2015 or to serve 10 days in HOC, consecutive.  Defendant may request an  extension and Court will grant if not paid in full.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence.  TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.

Provide DNA sample to the Wisconsin State Crime Laboraty for DNA testing.
Court advised defendant:  that as a convicted felon he may never possess  any gun or other firearms; and that his voting rights are suspended and may not vote in any election  until his civil rights are restored.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Andre R Beaton

records.addlTxt: Per Chief Judge Directive 18-02, the Fine & Cost commitment previously entered in this case shall be converted to a civil judgment.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: F&C Commitment issued for failure to pay.  10 days HOC,  consecutive.   Due & owing.
done in error- court order to serve in hoc if fine was not paid by due date. vp
email from Probation Agent, Christine Kulinski, received and filed.  aw

Defendant Andre R Beaton in court with attorney Reyna Ivonne Morales.  Antonella Aleman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  


The Court ordered the Defendant to serve 4 DAYS in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence with credit for 4 days time served.  
TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.

- Court ordered defendant to provide a DNA, and pay all MANDATORY COURT costs, fees, surcharges, and assessments, by 2/11/2015, or serve 10 days in the HOC, consecutive.  Defendant may request an extension, and court will grant if not paid in full.

Received and filed:
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.  aw
Justice Point Pretrial Services Violation Report received and filed due to missed office contact.  aw

Defendant Andre R Beaton in court with attorney Lisa Schlieben as a friend of the Court for Reyna Ivonne Morales.  Carole R. Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  ENTRY MADE WITHOUT THE COURT FILE.  Present in court is Justice Point Case worker Chelsee Bates.  Case in court due to violation.  Arguments heard as to bail.  Court admonishes Defendant.  No action taken at this time.  Case remains calendared on August 11, 2014 at at 8:30 a.m. in Branch 03.
-Justice Point Violation report; received and filed.   Deputy Court Clerk: TC.
Court was advised by Agent Kolinski that Mr. Beaton has intake on 7/3/2014 at 9:00 am at the Bridge.  Justice Point to call defendant, and have him report to Justice Point after his intake.  aw
Justice Point Pretrial Services Violation Report received and filed due to missed office contact.  aw

Defendant Andre R Beaton in court with attorney Reyna I Morales.  Dennis P Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin for Antonella Aleman.
Case set for sentencing.  Court wants to find out when defendant will be in treatment.  Case adjourned for sentencing on 8/11/2014 at 8:30 am, branch 3.  aw  Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 11, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Andre R Beaton in court with attorney Reyna I Morales.  Dennis P Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin for Antonella Aleman.  
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty.  Judgment of conviction entered.
  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess any gun or other firearms. 
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.  

Court also advises defendant if he is not a citizen of the United States of America, that upon a plea of guilty or no contest for this offense, he could be deported, excluded from admission to his country, or denied naturalization under federal law.  
Court advised that the defendant will have to provide a DNA sample, to the Wisconsin State Crime Laboratory for DNA testing.
Case adjourned for sentencing on 6/24/2014 at 8:30 am, branch 3. 
Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement, received and filed.  aw
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.  aw

ENTRY MADE WITHOUT THE COURT FILE.  
Present in court is Justice Point Case worker TONY FINGER.  Case in court due to violation.  Arguments heard as to bail.  Court admonishes Defendant.  No action taken at this time.  Case remains calendared for PLEA/SENTENCING on JUNE 23, 2014 in Branch 3.

Defendant Andre R Beaton in court with attorney Danielle L Shelton.  James C Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj. 
JUSTICE POINT Pretrial Services Violation Report received and filed.

Defendant Andre R Beaton in court with attorney Reyna I Morales.  Dennis P Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin for Antonella Aleman.
NO FILE IN COURT.  
Defendant tested positive for THC.  Court admonished defendant on bringing his twin children to court, and ordered him to not bring them again.  Court orders the defendant to call his agent today, and inform her of the positive test.  Defendant to get into some type of treatment.  Court INCREASES defendant's supervision with Justice Point to INTENSIVE.  Court informs defendant that he will be taken into custody if he tests positive again.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.  aw
Certified records received and filed.  aw

Defendant Andre R Beaton in court with attorney Reyna I Morales.  Antonella Aleman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense counsel has no motions to be filed.  Case adjoruned for plea and sentencing on 6/23/2014 at 8:30 am, branch 3.  Court reminds defendant to not use or possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription.  aw  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 23, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Andre R Beaton in court with attorney Adam Galaviz for attorney Reyna I Morales.  Stephan E Nolten appeared for the State of Wisconsin for Antonella Aleman.
Defense counsel requests time to talk with ADA Aleman.  Case adjourned for scheduling conference on 4/29/2014 at 8:30 am, branch 3.  Court ordered all motions be filed by the next court date.  Court reminds defendant to not use or possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription.  aw

Defendant Andre R Beaton in court with attorney Ann Jaspers for Reyna Ivonne Morales.  Step Nolten for Antonella Aleman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Fiorenza, Branch 03.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pleads not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 16, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Filed, Justice Point Pretrial Report dated 3/28/14.
css
Preliminary hearing scheduled for 03-31-2014 at 01:30 pm.

As an additional condition of bail:
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.  Drug Testing.
No drugs without a valid prescription.

Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Andre R Beaton in court with Attorney Adam Galaviz.  Defendant Andre R Beaton in custody.  Timothy J. Cotter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Fiorenza, Branch 03.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Court orders case adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch 03.
Clerk:  jms
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
